page.title: 13Towie Pipers (Pipe Band)
page.content: Pipers leading Scottish Regiments into battle terrified enemies.Now they play at ceremonial occasions.Gordon Highlanders traditionally swell ranks with local men.So an army piping instructor gives chanter lessons at Towie School,part of a programme to promote the playing of bagpipes in the North East.As this instrument demands dedication,only 1/10 become good players.Towie Band results from a piping evening class,started at Towie School fourteen years ago by a local person who's pupil became band leader when it was formed four years ago.The proceeds of fund raising concerts bought the necessary equipment for the fifteen members.They feel slightly disadvantaged as large numbers produce the most rousing sound They are a popular attraction soon to be joined by new young pipers.
